All 120-volt, single-phase, 15-and 20-ampere receptacle outlets in lot service equipment shall be protected by ground-fault circuit protection. The requirement for ground-fault circuit protection shall not apply to equipment or installations constructed, installed, or approved for construction or installation prior to September 1, 1975 T25 CCR1180(e).

When the electrical meter-base equipment is to be attached to the MH-unit at the time of installation, an alteration permit for the unit is required pursuant to Section 18029 of the Health and Safety Code T25 CCR1180(g).

Parks constructed after January 1, 1997, shall have individual electric meters for each lot and shall be served by electrical distribution facilities owned, operated, and maintained by the electrical corporation as defined in section 218 of the Public Utilities Code providing electric service in the area, in accordance with Public Utilities Code section 2791  T-25 CCR1180(h)

When an electrical meter is installed as an integral component of the lot service equipment, it shall be of a class or rating that will accurately measure all loads up to the rated ampacity of the lot service equipment.  T-25, CCR 1180 (f)

When the electrical meter-base equipment is to be attached to the MH-unit at the time of installation, an alteration permit for the unit is required pursuant to Section 18029 of the Health and Safety Code.  T-25, CCR 1180 (g)

Approved lot service equipment supplied by underground feeders may be of the self–supporting type and shall be stabilized by concrete not less than three and one–half (3 1/2) inches thick and surrounding the equipment base by not less than six (6) inches beyond the equipment base in all directions. T-25, CCR 1182 (a)
Equipment to supply electrical power to a unit shall be located within four (4) feet of the unit or the proposed location of the unit. T-25, CCR 1184

All park–owned overhead electrical equipment of park electrical systems shall also comply with the applicable requirements of the current California Public Utilities Commission Rules for Overhead Electrical Line Construction, General Order No. 95. If there is any conflict between the provisions contained in the California Electrical Code and General Order 95, the provisions of General Order 95 shall prevail T-25, CCR 1134 (b).

All park–owned underground electric equipment of park electrical systems shall also comply with the applicable requirements of the current California Public Utilities Commission, Rules for Underground Electrical Supply and Communications Systems, General Order No. 128. If there is any conflict between the provisions contained in the California Electrical Code and General Order 128, the provisions of General Order 128 shall prevail. T-25, CCR 1134 (c)

All electrical equipment and devices, including service equipment, transformers and receptacles, shall be protected by overcurrent protective devices rated at not more than the rating of the equipment or device, except as provided in Articles 210, 240, 430, and 450 of the California Electrical Code. T-25, CCR 1148
Fake MH code for testing purposes
Fake RV code for testing purposes
Fake OL code for testing purposes
Fake SPCM code for testing purposes
Fake CM code for testing purposes
Fake SAA code for testing purposes

A habitable room created by the construction of a cabana shall not be less than seven (7) feet in any horizontal dimension, and (2) shall have a superficial floor area of not less than seventy (70) square feet, excluding a private toilet and bath compartment or storage area. For purposes of this subsection, horizontal dimension requirements for rooms created by the construction of a cabana may include existing space within the unit T-25, CCR 1448(b))(1)&(2)&(3).

Where ventilation of a room is by natural means, openings such as windows, skylights, grilles or gravity vents shall have a minimum net free cross¿sectional area opening to the outer air equal to five (5) percent of; gross floor areaT25 CCR1458(c).

Required windows of a cabana shall open to an open space, either directly or through a porch or awning having a minimum clear height of not less than six (6) feet two (2) inches. Such porch or awning shall be at least fifty (50) percent open on the side opposite the windows T25 CCR 1458(d).

Where mechanical ventilation is installed, it shall be capable of producing two (2) air changes per hour with not less than one¿fifth (1/5) of the air supply taken from outside the cabana, except that in bathrooms, toilet rooms or service rooms, the mechanical ventilation system, connected directly to the outside, shall be capable of providing five (5) air changes per hour. T-25, CCR 1458(f).

When a fuel burning water heater is enclosed in a cabana, the water heater shall comply with the requirements for installation in bedrooms and bathrooms contained in Chapter 5 of Title 24, Part 5, the California Plumbing Code and the requirements for seismic bracing T25 CCR 1462(b).

The occupied area of a lot, consisting of the unit, and all accessory buildings and structures including, but not limited to awnings, stairways, ramps and storage cabinets, shall not exceed seventy¿five (75) percent of the lot area. For purposes of this chapter, patios and paved or concreted areas on grade, and the area of accessory buildings or structures located under another accessory structure, such as a storage cabinet or porch under an awning or carport, are not included in the measurement of the occupied area. The occupied area shall be determined as if viewed from overhead looking directly down on the lot. T-25, CCR 1110

When constructed of noncombustible materials: may be up to the lot line, provided a minimum three (3)¿foot clearance is maintained from any other unit, accessory building or structure, or building component on adjacent lots T25 CCR 1428(a)(1)(A).

When constructed of combustible materials: a minimum three (3)¿foot clearance from all lot lines, and a minimum six (6)¿foot clearance from any other unit, accessory buildings or structures, or building components on adjacent lots constructed of combustible materials T5 CCR 1428(a)(2)(A)&(b).
No portion of an accessory building or structure, or building component shall project over or beyond a lot line T25 CCR 1428(f).

Any accessory building or structure, or building component may be installed up to a lot line bordering a roadway or common area provided there is no combustible building or structure in the common area within six (6) feet and no building or structure of any kind within three (3) feet of any portion of the accessory building or structure, or building component. The maximum seventy-five percent (75%) lot coverage allowed by section 1110 of this chapter shall be maintained T25 CCR 1428(g).
Fake SOP code for testing purposes
Fake FBH code for testing purposes

Wood awning or carport support posts four (4) inches or greater in nominal thickness may be located up to a lot line provided the remainder of the awning or carport is composed of noncombustible material. T-25, CCR 1428(h).
The stairway may be capable of being relocated and need not be secured to the lot. T-25 CCR 1498(e)

Where a door of the MH-unit swings outward the floor of the exterior landing or porch shall be not more than one (1) inch lower than the bottom of the door; and (2) the width and depth of the exterior landing or porch serving stairs perpendicular to any out-swinging door opening shall comply with subsection (a) of this section and shall not be less than the full width of the door when open at least ninety (90) degrees. Guard rails shall permit the door to open at least ninety (90) degrees T25 CCR 1498b)(2).

Where the MH-unit door swings inward or is a sliding door, the landing, porch, or top step of the stairway may not be more than seven and one¿half (7 1/2) inches below the door. The width of the landing, porch, or top step of the stairway shall comply both with subsection (a) of this section and not be less than the width of the door opening. A landing or porch is not required when the stairway has a straight run up to the door opening T25 CCR 1498(d).
Porches may be supported on piers in lieu of continuous footings. Individual piers shall be designed and constructed to evenly distribute the loads carried to the footings T25 CCR 1500(a).

A Ramada or any portion thereof shall have a clearance of not less than eighteen (18) inches in a vertical direction above any plumbing vent extending through the roof of a unit and not less than six (6) inches in a horizontal direction from each side of a unit T25 CCR 1486(d).

Landing, Porch & Stairway: Requirements for the design and construction of all structural elements of porches and stairways and railings are contained in the California Residential Code, except as otherwise provided by this article. Live loads applicable to porch floors and stairways shall be not less than forty (40) psf. Porches shall be designed and constructed as completely freestanding, self¿supporting structures. Except as otherwise provided in this article, stairways and ramps shall be a minimum of thirty-six (36) inches in width T25 CCR 1498(a).

The occupied area of a lot, consisting of the unit, and all accessory buildings and structures including, but not limited to awnings, stairways, ramps and storage cabinets, shall not exceed seventy¿five (75) percent of the lot area. T-25 CCR 1110(a).
A three (3) foot separation shall be maintained from a private garage or storage building and any lot line which does not border on a roadway T25 CCR 1443(b).
A storage cabinet shall not be used as a habitable structure, or any part of a habitable structure T25 CCR 1510(b).

violations.code: fire hazard severity zones sra & lra
violations.longDescription: Accessory buildings or structures or building components constructed or installed in parks in a State Responsibility Area Fire Hazard Severity Zone or a local Very-High Fire Hazard Severity Zone, as indicated on the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection¿s Fire Hazard Severity Zone Maps, shall comply with Title 24, Part 2.5, Chapter 3, section R327 of the California Residential Code (CRC) which is hereby incorporated by reference with the exception of the following provisions: Sections R327.1.5, R327.2 (Fire Protection Plan) and R327.3.6.

Accessory buildings or structures or building components constructed or installed outside of parks in a State Responsibility Area Fire Hazard Severity Zone, a local Very-High Fire Hazard Severity Zone, or a local Wildland-Urban Interface Fire Area shall comply with the provisions of the CRC, Title 24, Part 2.5, Chapter 3, section R327. T-25, CCR 1426

Roof connections shall be made as required by the manufactures instructions or with a 3/8¿ diameter lag bolt or equivalent, of length sufficient to ensure a tight connection. The lag bolts or equivalent shall be installed 24¿ on center. The lag bolts shall be staggered on alternating sides where the multi-section rooflines meet (T25CCR1335b2). Install bolting as required.

Mobile home units manufactured prior to October 7, 1973, or mobile home units for which the manufacturer¿s installation instructions are unobtainable, shall be supported with perimeter blocking. The MH unit shall have wall supports under each end of a side wall opening that is 48¿ or more in width, and under the perimeter walls at 8¿ intervals with footings sizes not less than two hundred seventy-five square inches (T25CCR1335.5). Install perimeter blocking as required.

violations.code: structural mh-unit support system floor joist
violations.longDescription: The minimum clearance of 18¿ between the underside of the floor joist, and grade level of the lot and the minimum clearance of 12¿ between the main chassis beams of the MH-unit and grade level of the lot in violation of 25 CCR 1344. Provide the required clearances.

violations.code: structural mh-unit support system septic leach
violations.longDescription: The MH-unit is located less than 5¿ from the septic tank and less than 8¿ from the leach field in violation of 25 CCR 1248b.
Footings must be precast or poured in place concrete not less than 3 ¿¿ in thickness with the lowest point of the footing below the frost line as required by 25 CCR 1334.4 a, b & c.

violations.code: structural frost line footings additional inspect
violations.longDescription: An additional inspection is required for verification of the footing depth below the frost line and after backfill as required by 25 CCR 1334.4 g.

The top of guards shall not be less than 42 inches in height (California Residential Code 312.1.2). Open guards shall have balusters or ornamental patterns such that a 4¿ diameter sphere cannot pass through any opening.
The MH-unit is not level in violation of T25CCR 1348.
The lot is not defined by permanent corner markers. Corner markers shall be visible at grade and shall be installed in a manner that does not create a hazard (T25CCR1104b).

The MH-unit is located less than the required setback from the property line in violation of T25CCR 1330(a)(b). Parks, or portions of parks, constructed prior to September 15, 1961, units shall not be located closer than six (6) feet from any permanent building or another unit (T25CCR1330a). In parks, or portions of parks, constructed on or after September 15, 1961, minimum setback and separation of not less than 10¿ (T25CCR1330b).

The lot under the MH-unit is not graded to prevent the migration of water to the under-floor area of the home in violation of T25CCR 1116(b). Drainage from a lot, site, roadway or park area shall be directed to a surface or subsurface drainage way and shall not drain onto an adjacent lot, or site. All vegetation shall be cleared from the area of the lot beneath the unit. Minor load bearing grading and area fills that are made with a compacted class 2 aggregate and that do not exceed six (6) inches in depth, do not require additional approvals.

It shall be unlawful for any listing or testing agency to list as ¿approved¿ or authorize the use of its labels for any MH-Unit earthquake resistant bracing system until such system is certified by the department. T-25, CCR 1370.2
The permit shall be in the possession of the installer and available to the enforcement agency during the installation of an earthquake resistant bracing system T25 CCR 1374.7(b).
Each lot shall be provided with a drain inlet not less than three (3) inches in diameter and shall be connected to an approved sewage disposal system T25 CCR 1254(a).

Drain inlets shall be provided to accommodate a threaded or clamp–type fitting for connecting drain connectors at proper grade. The drain inlet shall be accessible at ground level. The vertical riser of a drain inlet shall not exceed three (3) inches in height above the concrete supporting slab. Drain inlets shall be gas–tight when not in use T25 CCR 1254(b).

Each drain inlet shall be protected from movement by being encased in a concrete slab not less than three and one–half (3 1/2) inches in thickness and surrounding the inlet by not less than six (6) inches on any side T25 CCR 1254(c).

The lot drain inlet shall be located within four (4) feet of the outside of the unit, or under the unit within eighteen (18) inches of the exterior wall of the unit T-25, CCR 1254(e). Pipe Size; As per T-25, CCR 1268.
The lot water outlet shall be located within four (4) feet of the outside of the unit, or under the unit within eighteen (18) inches of the exterior wall of the unit T25 CCR 1274(b).

Except as otherwise permitted or required by this article, all fuel gas equipment and installations for supplying fuel gas to units or accessory buildings or structures, and fuel gas piping systems outside of permanent buildings in parks, shall comply with the requirements found in the California Plumbing Code, Chapter 12. Federal Regulations; As Per T-25, CCR 1206
Local Fire Prevention Code Enforcement; As Per T-25, CCR 1302

No person shall construct, reconstruct, modify, or alter any installations relating to fire protection equipment within a park unless a written permit has been obtained from the enforcement agency with written evidence of approval from the fire agency responsible for fire suppression in the park. T-25, CCR 1306

violations.code: fire protection private fire hydrant systems
violations.longDescription: Private Fire Hydrant Operation & Water Flow Requirements; T-25, CCR 1316.
Private Fire Hydrant Test & Certification; As Per T-25, CCR 1317

violations.code: deck porch support systems crc reference
violations.longDescription: The requirements for stairways and handrails are contained in the California Residential Code, except as otherwise provided in this chapter. T-25, CCR 1504

When a ramp and handrail are to be constructed in place of a stairway, the requirements for the design and construction of the ramp and handrail are contained in the California Residential Code, except as otherwise provided in this chapter T-25, CCR 1506
A Ramada shall be designed and constructed as a freestanding, self¿supporting structure meeting the structural requirements for cabanas as specified in section 1446 T25 CCR 1486(b).

A Ramada shall not be enclosed or partially enclosed on any side or end, except that the sides may be enclosed when the Ramada roof is continuous with the roof of a cabana constructed on the sides of the unit T25 CCR 1486(c).

A minimum of two (2) ventilating openings shall be installed at the highest point in the Ramada roof to eliminate the buildup of products from vents or ducts. Vent openings shall be located near the ends of the Ramada for cross¿ventilation and shall have a minimum cross¿sectional area of twenty¿eight (28) square inches. Chimneys or vents of fuel burning appliances shall extend through the Ramada roof surface and shall terminate in an approved roof jack and cap installed in accordance with the appliance listing and the manufacturer¿s installation instructions. T-25 CCR 1486(e).

A private garage or storage building may be located immediately adjacent to a unit if the garage or storage building wall adjacent to the unit is constructed of materials approved for one (1) hour fire¿resistant construction. If there are openings which are not one (1) hour fire¿rated in the unit wall adjacent to the garage or storage building wall, a minimum of three (3) feet of separation shall be maintained. A minimum of six (6) feet of separation shall be maintained between the unit and a private garage or storage building which does not meet the requirements for one (1) hour fire¿resistant construction T25 CCR 1443(a).

Garages shall be designed and constructed as freestanding structures. They shall not be attached to or supported by an MH-Unit; however, to provide a weather seal, flashing or sealing materials may be affixed between the garage and the MH-Unit T-25 CCR 1443(c).

A storage cabinet may be located immediately adjacent to a unit on the same lot, provided all of the following conditions are met: The required exits and openings for light and ventilation of the unit, cabana, or building component are not obstructed; and The location does not prevent service or inspection of the unit¿s or lot¿s equipment or utility connections; and (3) The separation requirements from structures on adjacent lots, contained in section 1428 of this chapter, are maintained T25 CCR 1510.
A storage cabinet shall not exceed ten (10) feet in height T25 CCR 1510(c).
The total, combined floor area of all storage cabinets on a lot shall not exceed one hundred twenty (120) square feet. T-25, CCR 1510(d).

A fence located on a lot shall not exceed six (6) feet in height. A fence exceeding forty¿two (42) inches in height, parallel to a unit or habitable accessory building or structure or building component, shall not be located closer than three (3) feet to that unit, habitable accessory building or structure, or building component T-25 CCR 1514.

An enclosed accessory building or structure or building component may be constructed or installed to enclose an emergency exit window from a sleeping room within a unit provided the enclosed area adjacent to the emergency exit window has a door not less than twenty¿eight (28) inches in width and seventy¿four (74) inches in height providing direct access to the outside. The exit doorway from the enclosed accessory building or structure, or building component shall comply with the exit illumination requirements contained in the California Residential Code and lighting outlet requirements contained in the California Electrical code T25 CCR 1429(a).

An accessory building or structure which encloses a required exit doorway from an MH-unit shall have an exit path and exit that does not violate the exit facilities requirements for manufactured homes, as contained in the Manufactured Home Construction and Safety Standards, 24CFR, Part 3280.105 T25 CCR 1429(b).

An awning enclosure that encloses a required exit shall not be divided with interior walls or barriers unless the divided areas contain additional exit doors serving the divided areas that comply with subsection (a). T-25, CCR 1429(c).
The minimum clear height of any awning shall not be less than six (6) feet two (2) inches.  T-25, CCR 1470

Concrete slabs less than three and one¿half (3 1/2) inches thick may be considered to have an allowable load bearing capacity of three¿hundred¿fifty (350) pounds per column. The enforcement agency may accept a loading not to exceed five¿hundred (500) pounds per column, provided the slab is not less than three and one¿half (3 1/2) inches thick and in good condition. The weight of individual poured concrete footings shall be one and one¿half (1 1/2) times the calculated uplift force. The weight of concrete shall be assumed to be not more than one hundred forty¿five (145) pounds¿per¿cubic¿foot. T-25, CCR 1472

When constructed of combustible materials: a minimum three (3)¿foot clearance from all lot lines, and (B) a minimum six (6)¿foot clearance from any other unit, accessory buildings or structures, or building components on adjacent lots constructed of combustible materials T25 CCR 1474(b).
Awnings may be partially enclosed with solid, opaque panels, provided the panels do not exceed fifty (50) percent of the total wall area T25 CCR 1474(c)(4).

Where an awning is erected or constructed immediately adjacent to or over a permanently constructed retaining wall of fire resistant material, there shall be not less than eighteen (18) inches clear ventilating opening between the underside of the awning roof and the top of the wall extending the full length of the awning T25 CCR 1474(d).

An awning shall not be enclosed unless the enclosure is designed and constructed as a freestanding structure or unless the awning is designed and constructed to withstand the additional forces imposed by the enclosure T25 CCR 1474(e).
Drop ceilings may be supported by the MH-unit provided the combined weight of the ceiling and the awning complies with section 1468(d) T25 CCR 1474(h).
A carport may be constructed or maintained on a lot only as an accessory structure to a unit located on the same lot T25CCR1466.
A carport shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the structural requirements for awnings as specified in section 1468.
At least two (2) sides or one (1) side and one (1) end of a carport shall be maintained at least fifty (50) percent open and unobstructed at all times T25 CCR 1478(e).
A carport which is partially enclosed shall be designed and constructed to withstand the additional lateral forces imposed by such an enclosure as required for awning enclosures T25 CCR 1478(e)(1).

Where a carport is constructed immediately adjacent to or over a permanently constructed retaining wall of fire resistant material, there shall not be less than eighteen (18) inches clear ventilating opening between the underside of the carport roof and the top of the wall extending the full length of the carport. T-25 CCR 1478

Electrical equipment and installations within an accessory building or structure or building component and the circuit supplying power shall be installed by a permanent wiring method and shall comply with the requirements for electrical installations of this chapter T25 CCR 1436(a).

Flexible cord shall not be used to supply an accessory building or structure or building component, or as a substitute for the fixed wiring of an accessory building or structure or building component T25 CCR 1436(b).

Unless otherwise specified by this article, electrical service provided to an accessory building or structure or building component may be supplied by either of the following: from the lot service equipment, provided: a permit is obtained to alter the lot electrical service by installing a separate overcurrent protective device rated not more than the total calculated electrical load, and the lot service equipment is capable of supplying the additional load, and the overcurrent protective device and its installation complies with the California Electrical Code from an MH-Unit provided: the MH-Unit is capable of supplying the additional load, and a permit to alter the MH-Unit¿s electrical system, substantiated with load calculations, is obtained from the department pursuant to the California Code of Regulations, Title 25, Division 1, Chapter 3.  T-25, CCR 1436.

Requirements for heating, ventilating, comfort cooling systems, and fireplaces constructed or installed in, or in conjunction with, accessory buildings or structures or building components are contained in the California Mechanical Code T25 CCR 1438.

A window awning shall not project more than forty¿two (42) inches from the exterior wall of the unit. Window and door awnings shall not extend more than six (6) inches horizontally beyond either side of a window or door and shall meet the location requirements of section 1428.

With insect screening or removable flexible plastic material. Awning drop or side curtains shall not be permanently fastened at the sides or bottom. (A permit to construct is not required.) T25 CCR 1471(c)(1).

The requirements for fuel gas piping, plumbing systems, and equipment installed in accessory buildings or structures or building components are contained in the California Plumbing Code, except as otherwise specified in this article T25 CCR 1440(a).

A unit directly connected to the water distribution system of a park shall be connected with piping and fittings listed and approved for that purpose. Flexible hose shall not be used as a substitute for water piping or connections. T-25 CCR 1440(b).

Cabanas may be installed using a support system in lieu of continuous footings. Girders shall be designed and constructed to evenly distribute the loads carried to the footings. Support systems shall comply with the applicable requirements of section 1334.

When a support system is used in lieu of a foundation system, the cabana shall comply with the tie-down requirements for manufactured homes as specified in sections 1336.1 through 1336.3. T-25, CCR 1450

Where a concrete floor on grade is used, it shall have a thickness of not less than three¿and¿one¿half (3 1/2) inches. The surface of a concrete floor shall not be less than two and one¿half (2 1/2) inches above the adjacent grade. Wood sills shall not be less than six (6) inches from adjacent earth. A wood floor may be laid directly on a waterproofed concrete slab. T-25, CCR 1452.

Each habitable room shall have an aggregate glazed window area of not less than eight (8) percent of the gross floor area for natural lighting with a minimum of fifty (50) percent of that glazed area able to be opened for ventilation. When the cabana encloses windows of the manufactured home or mobile home, park trailer, or travel trailer required for light and ventilation, the window area of the cabana shall be not less than the total area of windows enclosed by the cabana. A bathroom, toilet room, or service room shall have an aggregate window area of not less than three (3) square feet, except where an approved mechanical ventilation system is provided. When a service or storage room does not enclose or obstruct a window of the manufactured home or mobile home, park trailer, or travel trailer, no additional window area is required T25 CCR1458.

Awning enclosures shall be used only for recreational or outdoor living purposes and shall not be used as carports or storage rooms nor shall they be constructed or converted for use as a habitable room or a cabana.

Construction and installation of accessory buildings or structures or building components shall comply with the structural requirements of the California Residential Code, except as otherwise provided by this article. The enforcement agency may require accessory buildings and structures or building components be designed and constructed to withstand live loads, vertical uplift or horizontal forces from any direction in excess of the minimum loads specified in this chapter, based on local geologic, topographic, or climatic conditions, when approved by the department T25 CCR 1432(a).
Accessory buildings and structures constructed of aluminum or aluminum alloy shall be designed to conform to the specifications contained in the California Residential Code T25 CCR 1432(b).

Unless data to substantiate the use of higher values is submitted to the enforcement agency, the allowable loading of accessory buildings or structures or building components on the soil shall not exceed one thousand five-hundred (1,500) psf vertical soil bearing pressure, one hundred fifty (150) psf of depth lateral soil bearing pressure, and one hundred sixty-seven (167) psf frictional resistance for uncased cast-in-place concrete piles. T-25 CCR 1432(c).

A freestanding awning is not limited as to width or length, except that the total occupied area of a lot, including all accessory building or structures, shall not exceed seventy five (75) percent of the lot area in accordance with section 1110 of this chapter T25 CCR 1468.
With rigid, readily removable transparent, or translucent materials T25 CCR 1474(c)(2).

Awnings may be completely enclosed with solid material, provided that fifty (50) percent of the total wall area is translucent or transparent material, of which twenty¿five (25) percent of the total wall area shall be able to be opened for ventilation. Exiting requirements shall meet the requirements for a cabana T25 CCR 1474(c)(4).
The construction requirements for awning enclosures are contained in the California Residential Code T25 CCR 1474(f).
Heating, cooking, or fuel burning appliances or equipment shall not be installed or used within an awning enclosure T25 CCR 1474(g).
When an exit from the unit is enclosed, the exit from the enclosure shall satisfy the exit and lighting requirements contained in section 1429 of this chapter T-25 CCR 1474(i).

The occupied area of a lot, consisting of the unit, and all accessory buildings and structures including, but not limited to awnings, stairways, ramps and storage cabinets, shall not exceed seventy¿five (75) percent of the lot area. For purposes of this chapter, patios and paved or concreted areas on grade, and the area of accessory buildings or structures located under another accessory structure, such as a storage cabinet or porch under an awning or carport, are not included in the measurement of the occupied area. The occupied area shall be determined as if viewed from overhead looking directly down on the lot. T-25, CCR 1110

When constructed of noncombustible materials may be up to the lot line, provided a minimum three (3)¿foot clearance is maintained from any other unit, accessory building or structure, or building component on adjacent lots T25CCR1428(a)(1)(A).

When constructed of combustible materials: a minimum three (3)¿foot clearance from all lot lines, and a minimum six (6)¿foot clearance from any other unit, accessory buildings or structures, or building components on adjacent lots constructed of combustible materials. As Per T-25, CCR 1428(a)(2)(A)(B).

A freestanding carport, or a common freestanding carport for the use of the occupants of adjacent lots, may be erected on a lot line, provided that such a carport is constructed of material which does not support combustion, and provided that there is a minimum of three (3) feet clearance from any unit or any other structure on the adjacent lots. Such freestanding carports may be connected to a unit or other accessory building or structure by an open covered walkway not exceeding six (6) feet in width.
A carport shall conform to the dimensions specified in section 1470 for awnings.

The occupied area of a lot, consisting of the unit, and all accessory buildings and structures including, but not limited to awnings, stairways, ramps and storage cabinets, shall not exceed seventy¿five (75) percent of the lot area. For purposes of this chapter, patios and paved or concreted areas on grade, and the area of accessory buildings or structures located under another accessory structure, such as a storage cabinet or porch under an awning or carport, are not included in the measurement of the occupied area. The occupied area shall be determined as if viewed from overhead looking directly down on the lot. T-25 CCR 1110
No cooking or heating equipment shall be installed in an awning enclosure T-25, CCR 1438(a).

A cabana may be constructed, occupied, and maintained on a lot only as an accessory structure to a unit located on the same lot. A cabana shall not be erected, constructed, occupied or maintained on a lot as an accessory structure to a motor home, tent trailer, or slide¿in or truck¿mounted camper. T-25, CCR 1444

A cabana shall have a minimum ceiling height of seven feet from the finished floor to the finished ceiling, or, if there is no finished ceiling, to the bottom of the roof supports, except: A cabana must maintain a minimum ceiling height equal to the ceiling height of the unit for at least fifty (50) percent of the cabana; If the ceiling or roof is sloped, the minimum ceiling height is required for not less than one¿half (1/2) of the sloping ceiling area. No portion of any room having a ceiling height of less than five (5) feet shall be considered as contributing to the minimum area required by this section T25 CCR 1448(a)&(1)&(2).

An extension cord is being used to supply power to a source that requires a permanent wiring method.  Remove the extension cord and rewire using an approved permanent wiring method.  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1188(b)]
The MH-unit electrical flexible conduit cannot be buried or in contact with the ground. Uncover the flexible conduit and support above grade.  [25 CCR 1352(e), 2352(f)]
In addition to the main electrical supply, there is a second power supply to the unit.  Remove the second power supply.  [25 CCR 1352(f), 2352(f)]
The unit is not properly grounded.  Ground the unit by means of a grounding conductor run with circuit conductors or listed power supply cord.  [25 CCR 1352, 1163]
The main electrical panel of the unit is missing parts or components that now expose live electrical parts.  Install the approved parts/components.  [25 CCR 1606(d), 1607(d)]
The unit power cord covering is cracked or deteriorated exposing the conductors.  Replace the cord with a cord listed for manufactured home, mobilehome, or RV.  [25 CCR 1352(a)(1), 1606(d), 1607(d)]

The outer covering of the unit electrical cord has pulled away from the cord plug, exposing the conductors.  Repair or replace the cord or plug as necessary (tape or sealant is not an approved method of correction).  [25 CCR 1352(a)(1), 1606(d), 1607(d)]
The unit power supply cord is spliced or otherwise improperly altered.  Replace the power supply cord.  [25 CCR 1352(c)(2)]
The stairway and/or landing is structurally unsound.  Replace or reconstruct the stairway and/or landing. [25 CCR 1498(a), 1608(b)]
There is no complying stairway at each required exit.  Provide a complying stairway at each required exit.  [25 CCR 1368, 1429]
The step(s) of the stairway is/are structurally unsound.  Reconstruct or provide a new complying stairway.  [25 CCR 1498(a), 1608(b)]
There is an electrical hazard within the park.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the hazardous electrical condition(s).  [25 CCR 1134, 1136, 1140, 1188]
There is a fire safety hazard violation within the park.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the hazardous fire safety condition(s).  [25 CCR 1120]
There are violations within the park.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard condition(s).  [25 CCR 1100, 1102(a)]
There is a mechanical violation within the park.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard mechanical condition(s).  [25 CCR 1102(a)]
There is a plumbing violation within the park.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard plumbing condition(s). A permit is required for this work.  [25 CCR) 1102(a)]
The park is operating without a valid permit to operate.  Obtain a valid Permit to Operate.  [California Health & Safety Code, Section 18500
There is an electrical violation on your lot.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard electrical condition(s).  [25 CCR 1188(b), (c)]
There is a fire safety violation on the park lot.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the hazardous fire safety condition(s).  [25 CCR 1120]
There are violation(s) on the park lot.  Make the necessary repair(s) to eliminate the substandard condition(s).  [25 CCR 1100, 1102(a)]

A plumbing violation exists which directly affects the unit.  This condition violates minimum health and safety standards and requires correction.  A permit is required for this work. [25 CCR 1606(e), 1607(e)]

There is a structural violation on the lot.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard structural condition(s).  A permit may be required for this work. [25 CCR 1102(a), 1606(b), 1607(b)]

The park/lot electrical service equipment is not accessible for inspection, repair, or disconnection in case of emergency.  Provide an unobstructed working clearance around lot electrical equipment.  [25 CCR §1183; Reference: California Electrical Code, Article 110-26]
The park/lot electrical service equipment is not accessible for inspection or disconnect in case of emergency.  Remove the obstruction blocking access to the service equipment.   [25 CCR §1183]
One or more required exterior egress doors on a park owned building are blocked or locked preventing emergency exit.  Remove the obstruction.  [25 CCR 1606(k), 1607(k), and 1608(k)]
There is an excessive accumulation of animal feces in the common area of the park. [25 CCR 1114]

Water accumulation under the unit on the lot does not drain or dissipate within a reasonable period creating a health threat. Re-grade or otherwise drain the standing water or install an approved drainage system.  [25 CCR 1116(b)]
Water accumulation in roadway, in common areas, or on lot(s) creating a helath threat.  Re-grade, repair, drain, or install an approved drainage system to eliminate standing water. [25 CCR 1116]
violations.shortDescription: water accumulation in roadway, common areas

violations.longDescription: Liquid petroleum gas (LP) vessel(s) and/or container(s) is/are not secured to prevent accidental over turning.  Provide an approved method to secure and support the LP gas container(s) and/or vessel(s). (Example: Secure the LP vessels to the unit's hitch, a support post, or other approved means). [25 CCR 1208, 1211]

The lot contains liquid petroleum (LP) gas containers or vessels with a total capacity of 125 gallons or more.  LP gas contianers or vessels on a lot totaling one hundered twenty-five (125) US gallons or more shall comply with the applicable provisions of the Unfired Pressure Vessel Safety Orders, California Code of Regulations, Title 8, Chapter 4, Subchapter 1.  Comply wiht these provisions or reduce the capacity of the containers or vessels to less than 125 US gallons.  A permit is required for LP containers exceeding 60 gallons. [25 CCR 1208, 1210, 1211]

There is inadequate clearance around the liquid petroleum (LP) gas vessel(s) installed on the lot.  Provide the necessary separation, as measured from the filling connection or vent, to sources of ignition, direct vent appliances, and mechanical ventilation air intakes as follows:
     1.  Ten feet (10') for purposes of filling.
     2.  Five feet (5') to the pressure relief valve; the valve must be directed away 
          from openings in the building below the valve.
     3.  The tank may not be located in areas less than 50% open for ventilation.
[25 CCR 1208, 1211, 1212, 1220]

Liquid petroleum (LP) gas vessel(s) is stored inside or underneath an unventilated accessory structure or unit.  Remove the enclosure or obstruction to provide accessibility and ventilation to the gas meter.  [25 CCR 1212]
violations.shortDescription: LP gas vessel stored unventilated accessory structure/unit

violations.longDescription: The unit is connected to a natural gas supply but has a gas line system (unlined copper) designed and approved for liquid petroleum (LP) gas only.  Obtain a permit and replace the gas system or connect the LP system to LP gas only.  [25 CCR 1606(f), 1607(f)]
violations.shortDescription: unit connected to natural gas but approved for LP gas only

violations.longDescription: Gas piping has been extended beneath the mobilehome unit in an unapproved manner.  Provide metal hangers at maximum intervals of four feet (4') to support the gas piping under the home.  [25 CCR 1224(b), 1354(b), (c)]
violations.shortDescription: gas piping extended in an unapproved method

violations.longDescription: The water heater is not properly vented.  Properly vent the appliance to the exterior. [25 CCR 1438, 1606(f), 1607(f), 1608(f)]
Access to the water heater is obstructed by an accessory structure or other construction/storage.  Provide clear access to the water heater.  [25 CCR 1438, 1510, 1606(f), 1607(f), 1608(f)]
The water heater is not properly protected from the weather.  Provide a protective covering or enclosure for the water heater.  [25 CCR 1438, 1606(f), 1607(f), 1608(f)
There is inadequate combustion air to the water heater.  Provide combustion air openings to the water heater compartment.  [25 CCR 1438, 1606(f), 1607(f), 1608(f)]
violations.shortDescription: inadequate combustion air to water heater

violations.longDescription: The water heater pressure relief valve is inoperable, missing, or the pressure valve piping is of an inadequate size or is not properly extended to the exterior.  Provide an operating pressure relief valve and/or extend the drain on the valve.  The drain piping must be at least the size of the pressure relief valve threaded outlet and shall not be treaded on the discharge end. [25 CCR 1438, 1606(f), 1607(f), 1608(f); California Plumbing Code 608]

There is inadequate clearance from the water heater and/or its vent to combustible materials.
   1.  Provide minimum six inch (6")  clearance from single wall vent pipes to combustibles.
   2.  Provide minimum one inch (1") clearance from double wall, type "B" vent pipes to combustibles.
   3.  Provide clearance from the water heater to combustibles as specified by the water heater manufacturer. [25 CCR 1438, 1606(f), 1607(f), 1608(f), California Plumbing Code 516.5]
violations.shortDescription: inadequate clearance water heater/vent to combustible materials

violations.longDescription: The awning or carport supports are missing, severely damaged or unanchored. Repair, replace or reinstall the awning or carport supports.  [25 CCR 1608(b)]

A unit is located closer than three feet (3') to a lot line and is withing six feet (6') to combustible construction on an adjacent lot.  Provide a six-foot (6') separtaion to combustible construction on the adjacent lot or provide approved fire protection equivalent. [25 CCR 1330]
There is no documentation showing park-owned rental units have current registration.  Provide copies of current registration for all park-owned rental units. [HSC 18026]
violations.shortDescription: no current registration park-owned rental units

violations.longDescription: Park-owned rental units do not have the required insignia displayed on the units.  Provide insignias for all park-owned rental units.  If no insignia can be located, obtain confirmation of a HUD Label or request an insignia issuance inspection from this Department.  A permit is required for a replacement insignia at HCD. [HSC 18026]
violations.shortDescription: no insignia park owned rental units

violations.longDescription: Park-owned rental units do not have operable smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detector installed in all park-owned rental units.  Install smoke detectors in all bedrooms and hallways leading to bedrooms; install a carbon monoxide detector in units having gas-fired appliances.  [25 CCR 1606, 4326; HSC 18029.6]
violations.shortDescription: no operable smoke detectors/carbon monoxied park-owned rental units

violations.longDescription: A park owned liquefied petroleum gas tank, or its equipment, is not protected from vehicular damage.  Provide mechanical protection by posts, fencing, or other barriers as approved by the enforcement agency.  [25 CCR 1228]

"There is inadequate clearance around the liquefied petroleum gas vessel(s) installed on the lot.  Provide the necessary separation, as measured from the filling connection or vent, to sources of ignition, direct vent appliances, and mechanical ventilation air intakes as follows:
     1.   Ten feet (10') for purposes of filling.
     2.   Five feet (5') to pressure relief valve; the valve must be directed away from openings in the building below the valve.
     3.   The tank may not be located in areas with less than 50% open for ventilation.
[25 CCR 1208, 1211, 1220]
Note:  Lot electrical service is not considered a source of ignition."
The gas meter is inadequately supported.  Provide adequate support for the gas meter by means of post and bracket, or other approved means that will provide equivalent support.  [25 CCR 1226(a)]

The gas outlet riser is subject to damage from vehicular traffic or other causes.  Provide mechanical protection by posts, fencing or other barriers as approved by the enforcement agency.  [25 CCR 1228]

The lot gas shutoff valve and/or the meter is located under the unit, cabana, habitable accessory building or structure, or is in an inaccessible and/or unvented location.  Relocate the lot gas shutoff valve and/or meter to provide access and ventilation.  Ventilation of not less than fifty percent (50%) shall be provided if shut off valve and or meter is located in an unventilated location.  [25 CCR 1208, 1218, 1220(c), 1226(b)]
The unused lot gas outlet is not capped or plugged to prevent accidental discharge of gas.  Install an approved cap or plug on the unused gas outlet.  [25 CCR 1220(d), 1102(a)]

There is an electrical violation in the park building(s) causing the building to be substandard.  Make necessary repairs to the electrical system and eliminate the substandard electrical condition(s).  A permit is required for this work.  [25 ccr 1102(a), 1605(a), (d)]

There is a mechanical violation in the park building(s) causing the building(s) to be substandard. Make all necessary repairs and eliminate the substandard mechanical condition(s).  A permit is required for this work.  [25 CCR 1102(a), 1605(a), (f)]

There is a plumbing violation in the park building(s) causing the building(s) to be substandard.  Make all necessary repairs and eliminate the substand plumbing condition(s).  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1102(a), 1605(a), (e)]

There is a structural violation in the park building(s) causing the building to be substandard.  Make the necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard structural condition(s).  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1102(a), 1605(a), (b)]
There is a structural violation within the park.  Make necessary repairs to eliminate the substandard structural condition(s).  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1102(a)]

The lot electrical service equipment is not accessible for inspection, repair or disconnection in case of emergency.  Provide unobstructed working clearance.  [25 CCR 1183; Reference: California Electrical Code 110-16]

The lot electrical service equipment is not accessible for inspection or disconnect in case of emergency.  Remove the padlock to the lot pedestal or to the gate/fence blocking access to the lot.  [25 CCR, 1130, 1134, 1188]
violations.shortDescription: electrical service equipment not accessible - padlock

violations.longDescription: Part or the entire awning or carport is constructed with combustible material and is within three feet (3') of the lot line and six feet (6') from a unit or combustible structure on the adjacent lot.  Remove all combustible material within six feet (6') of the combustible construction on the adjacent lot. [25 CCR 1428(b)]
violations.shortDescription: awning/carport constructed w/combustible materials - lot line

violations.longDescription: Part or all of the awning or carport enclosure is constructed with combustible material and is within three feet (3') of the lot line and six feet (6') from a mobilehome or combustible structure on the adjacent lot.  Remove all combustible material within six feet (6') of the combustible construction on the adjacent lot. [25 CCR 1428(a), (b)]
violations.shortDescription: awning/carport constructed w/combustible materials - adjacent mobilehome

violations.longDescription: The cabana has been constructed within three (3) feet of the lot line.  Reconstruct or remove the cabana so that no portion of the structure is within three feet of the lot line.  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1428(b)]

A unit is located closer than three feet (3') to a lot line and is withing six feet (6') of a unit or combustible structure on on an adjacent lot.  Provide a six-foot (6') separtaion to combustible construction on the adjacent lot.  [25 CCR 1330]

The porch or deck is installed closer than three feet (3') to the lot line and is within six feet (6') of a unit or combustible structure on an adjacent lot.  Provide six-foot separation to combustible construction on the adjacent lot. [25 CCR 1428(a), (b)]

A storage cabinet (shed) is constructed with combustible material and is within three feet (3') of the lot line or six feet (6') from combustible construction on the adjacent lot.  Remove all combustible material from within six feet (6') of the combustible construction on the adjacent lot.  [25 CCR 1428(a), (b)]
There is no documentation showing unit has current registration.  Provide a copy of the current registration for the unit. [HSC 18026]

The unit does not have the required insignia displayed on the unit.  Provide insignia for the unit.  If no insignia can be located, obtain confirmation of a HUD Label or request an insignia issuance inspection from this Department.  A permit is required for a replacement insignia at HCD. [HSC 18026]

The unit does not have operable smoke detectors and carbon monoxide detector installed.  Install smoke detectors in all bedrooms and hallways leading to bedrooms; install a carbon monoxide detector if the unit has gas-fired appliances. [25 CCR 1606, 4326; HSC 18029.6]

A mechanical violation exists which affects the unit.  This condition violates minimum health and safety standards and requires correction.  A permit may be required for this work. [25 CCR 1606(f), 1607(f)]

The flexible gas connector between the unit and the lot gas outlet or liquefied petroleum gas tank is buried in the ground or encased in concrete.  Remove the dirt cover or concrete encasement.  [25 CCR 1208(a), 1606(f), 1607(f)]
The flexible gas connector between the unit and the lot gas outlet is damaged or deteriorated.  Replace the flexible gas connector.  [25 CCR 1606(f), 1607(f)]

Electrical equipment and/or electrical receptacles installed in an exterior location are not approved for wet or damp locations.  Remove the unapproved equipment or device(s) or replace with equipment or device(s) approved for installation in damp or wet locations.  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1134(a), 1170(a)]

There is an accumulation of refuse, garbage, rubbish, lumber scraps, waste paper, hay, grass, straw, weeds, litter, or  other combustible waste on the roof of the unit or in the open space.  Collect and dispose these materials.  [25 CCR 1120(a)]

One or more required exterior egress doors are blocked or locked with an exterior hasp, preventing emergency exit.  Remove the material or hasp from in front of the door(s) and provide for proper exiting.  [25 CCR 1606(k), 1607(k)]
There is an excessive accumulation of animal feces on the lot.  Remove the animal feces from the lot.  [25 CCR 1114]

More than one unit occupying the lot.  Remove the additional unit(s).  Exception: Only self-propelled RVs or truck mounted campers may be parked beside the unit or be on the lot when used as a means of transportation.  Such vehicles shall not be occupied or connected to the lot utilities or interconnected with the occupied unit.  [25 CCR 1118]

No permit was obtained for the installation and/or construction performed.  No person shall erect, construct, reconstruct, install, replace, relocate or alter any building, structure or accessory building, any electrical, mechanical, or plumbing equipment, any fuel gas equipment installation, or any fire protection equipment within a mobilehome park or a mobilehome lot without first obtaining a written construction permit.  [25 CCR 1018]
There is a leak in the drain line system of the unit.  Repair the leak.  [HSC 18554; 25 CCR 1606(e), 1607(e)]
A mobilehome has been installed without a valid permit. Obtain a permit to install the mobilehome.  [25CCR 1324]

The drain line system is not maintained with a proper grade.  A grade of not less than 1/8 inch (1/8") per foot between the mobilehome or RV and the lot drain inlet must be provided.  [25 CCR 1358(d), 1606(e), 1607(e)]

Waste water from the clothes washer, sink, or other plumbing fixture is being discharged upon the ground or into an unapproved plumbing connection.  A connection must be installed to an approved drainage system.  [ HSC 18554, 25 CCR 1358 1606(e), 1607(e), 1608(e)]
The awning or carport is structurally unsound.  Remove or repair the awning or carport to meet minimum structural requirements.  [25 CCR 1608(b)]

The porch and/or deck is constructed 30 inches (30") or more above the ground, and does not have a guardrail.  Provide a guardrail around the perimeter of the porch and/or deck. Construct a guardrail a minimum forty-two inches (42") above the porch or deck floor with intermediate rails or pickets spaced no more than four inches (4") apart.  [25 CCR 1502; Reference: California Residential Code 312.12]

The stairway to the mobilehome or accessory structure does not have a handrail.  Every stairway with four or more steps or more than 30 inches (30") above grade shall be equipped with handrails and intermediate rails.  Install the required handrail and intermediate rails on the stairway.  [25 CCR 1504, California Building Code 509]

The garage or storage building is constructed with combustible material and is within three feet (3') of the lot line or six feet (6') from a mobilehome, RV, or combustible structure on the adjacent lot.  Remove all combustible material within  six feet (6') of the combustible construction on the adjacent lot.  [25 CCR 1443]
The storage cabinet (shed) is substandard.  Reconstruct or remove the storage cabinet (shed).  [25 CCR 1608(b)]
The awning or carport enclosure is structurally unsound.  Remove the enclosure or repair to meet minimum structural requirements.  A permit is required for this work. [25 CCR 1608(b)]

The condition of the cabana is substandard due to faulty weather protection, improper maintenance, structural inadequacies, or other deficiencies.  Repair the substandard condition or remove the cabana from the lot.  A permit is required for this work.  [25 CCR 1608(a), (b), (g)]

The ramp does not have a guardrail or the guardrail does not extend the full length of the ramp.  Provide a guardrail no less than forty-two inches (42") along the length of the ramp. [25 CCR 1506; Reference: California Building Code 1010, 1013]

The porch, deck, or ramp does not have intermediate rails installed on the guardrails.  Install intermediate rails or pickets spaced not more than four inches (4") apart.  [25 CCR 1506; Reference: California Building Code 1010, 1013]
The private garage or storage building is structurally unsound.  Reconstruct or remove the garage or storage building.  A permit is required for this work. [25 CCR 1608(b)].
The porch/deck is structurally unsound.  Reconstruct or remove the structure. A permit is required for this work. [25 CCR 1608(b)]

A faulty weather protection condition exists which directly affects the unit.  This condition violates minimum health and safety standards and requires correction.  A permit is required for this work.  [25 CCR 1606(g), 1607(g)]

The gas meter on the lot has been enclosed or obstructed in such a manner that restricts ventilation to the gas meter. Remove the enclosure or obstruction to provide accessibility and ventilation to the gas meter. [25 CCR 1226(b)]

The unit power supply cord is buried in the ground or encased in concrete.  Remove the dirt or concrete covering and if deteriorated, replace the power supply cord.  [25 CCR 1188(b), 1352(g), 2352(f)]

The unit power supply cord rated capacity is less than the total connected electrical load for the unit.  Replace the power supply cord with a power supply assembly or cord rated for the ampacity of the connected load.  [25 CCR 1352(c) 2352(c)]

There is an exposed non-metallic electrical cable (romex type) subject to physical damage.  Remove the exposed non-metallic cable or install in an approved manner.  Comment location.  [25 CCR 1134(a); Reference: California Electrical Code, Article 336-6]
The lot electrical service equipment does not have the capacity to supply the installed unit.  Provide lot electrical service equipment properly sized to supply the connected unit.  [25 CCR 1188(a)]

The lot/park electrical service equipment is in disrepair or substandard condition and/or not weather proof.  Repair or replace the lot/park electrical service equipment. A permit may be required for this work. [25 CCR 1170(a), 1134(a), 1188(b); Reference:  California Electrical Code, Article 230]
The lot service equipment support is inadequate and/or deteriorated.  Repair or replace the supports.  [25 CCR 1182(a), (b), and 1605(d)]

The overhead conductors are located less than eight feet over the unit's roof.  Relocate the overhead conductors to provide at least eight feet of clearance.  [25 CCR 1134(b); California Public Utilities Commission Rules for Overhead Electrical Line Construction, GO 95, Table 1]

There is no operable water outlet for fire suppression at the individual lot.  Provide a 3/4" inch valve water outlet (hose bib) designed for connecting a 3/4" inch female swivel hose connection for fire suppression on the lot.  [25 CCR 1274, 1308]

There has been construction performed without a permit.  No person shall erect, construct, reconstruct, install, replace, relocate, or alter any building, structure, or accessory structure, any electrical, mechanical, or plumbing equipment, fuel gas equipment, or fire protection equipment within a mobilehome park without first obtaining a written construction permit.  [25 CCR 1018(a), 1102]

The overhead conductor support structures are inadequate and/or have deteriorated.  Repair or replace support structures in accordance with the California Public Utilities Commission Rules for Overhead Electrical Line Construction, General Order No. 95.  A permit may be required for this work. [25 CCR 1134 (b); PUC GO 95]

There is exposed non-metallic electrical cable (romex type) being used where it is subject to physical damage.  Remove the wiring or install in an approved manner.  A permit may be required for this work.  [25 CCR 1134 (a); Reference:  California Electrical Code, Article 336-6(b)]

The electrical distribution panels, overcurrent devices, fuses or switches which serve the space, fixture, device or other equipment controlled at the distribution panels are not clearly and permanently marked.  Clearly and permanently mark electrical distribution panels, overcurrent device, fuses or switches to identify the space, fixture, device or other equipment controlled at each distribution panel.  [25 CCR 1134(a), 1151; Reference:  California Electrical Code, Article 110-22, 230-70, 408.4(A)]
A MH-unit has been installed without a permit.  Obtain a permit to install the unit.  [25 CCR 1324]
There is sewage leak at the lot drain. Eliminate the leak.  [California Health and Safety Code, Section 18554, 25 CCR 1246, 1102(a)]
The lot sewer inlet and/or clean out is open.  Provide a gas-tight cap or plug for the opening when not in use.  [25 CCR 1102(a), 1254(b)]
Appliance(s) is installed outside of the unit exposed to the weather.  Relocate the appliance(s) out of the weather.  [25 CCR 1134(a)]
